text: b'@DCDetective2 What did you do to get better?'
b'@Mancman10 @scotpolitik @HowShouldWeVote Still bloody moaning about #Brexit Get a grip!'
b'@Mancman10 ...because they disagree with you they are bigots? You are a bloody idiot!'
b'@OoshOne Thank you. I moved forces a couple of years ago to get away from those who made me feel so ill. I am better now..'
b'@OoshOne At work so business head on. Work is where I seem to be able to manage it (generally speaking). Anxiety always there though! :)'
b'@IanMcFadyen1966 Deaf ears I suspect.'
b'@saddetective Please send me details...I need help.'
b'@saddetective It cost me my marriage and PTSD and depression and I considered taking my own life...too much of a coward though!'
b'@saddetective Yr blog is interesting. Similar issues for me. I was sacked by my Force but on appeal all evidence against me was overturned'
b'@saddetective Can you recover?'
b'@saddetective @GoodCopDown At work I hide it...no one would ever know. At home I am a mess but again try to hide it. Tonight bad.'
b'@saddetective Is support group anonymous? @GoodCopDown'
b'@NathanConstable I am sure you are well meaning and it may help. I hope so because job needs people like you'
b"@NathanConstable You can't disagree with me because I know the truth!"
b'I hope I can hide my #PTSD and depression until I retire! #depression #Tired'
b"@NathanConstable They won't reply honestly. None of my bosses know as I transferred to a new force to get away from those I did mention to."
b"@saddetective Sometimes I think it's all ok and gone away but it's always there just lurking in the shadows.... generally I am better now.:)"

b"RT @dc_suspicious: @CopsAgainst I'm hearing a colleague from the met has asked to see your accounts and she's not had a reply \xf0\x9f\x98\xb3\xf0\x9f\x98\xb3\xf0\x9f\x98\xb3\xf0\x9f\x95\xb5\xf0\x9f\x95\xb5\xf0\x9f\x95\xb5"
b'@MentalHealthCop Wish had known where to turn at the time. Nearly ended my life that week. How I survived I still dont know.@MrNickKnowles'
b"@MentalHealthCop @MrNickKnowles Why I told my DS & DI I had been diagnosed with depression &PTSD. They told me they were fed up of my 'shit'"
b'@CopsAgainst Have to agree with @CID_Detective @dc_suspicious Police pension still very good. Hardly a problem to work until yr 60.'
b'RT @Pete_j_morris: @ChiefConPSNI very real problem in your force. Dry your eyes appropriate? You forget this?  https://t.co/VcDj50dkLM'
b'RT @Puneet_Netar: @PoliceFedforNI @BullshirePolice https://t.co/PEc8kZoXG9'
b'@ACCMartinPSNI Heartless does not begin to explain words of @ChiefConPSNI Code of ethics does mention leadership! Have a read #policing'
b'@thinbluelineuk @ChiefConPSNI Pathetic apology which misses entire point. We always dry eyes & carry on,thats the point! #ptsd #depression'
b'@Peter_Kirkham Hopefully all the bins are clean and empty. #policing https://t.co/ZY4OCtrWoE'
b'Great song from UK #SBSEurovision'
b"Will never forget the day my first line supervisor told me:' I've had enough of your shit'. He knew I had #ptsd #depression #policing"
b'Just wanted to tell everyone I am feeling good at the moment. #ptsd #depression'
b'RT @Active_Minds: 28 realities about living with #depression that often get overlooked https://t.co/GpXUZ8ASuk #WhatYouDontSee'
b'@katy_mama Thankyou.'
b'RT @PFEW_HQ: #PFEWs Welfare Support Programme has seen the number of at risk officers on its books soar in the last 10 months https://t.co/\xe2\x80\xa6'
